title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.15 - Car rental-airport-concession
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 1160.15 - Car rental-airport-concession

State Regulations
(a) General system--privileges granted. A
concessionaire car rental business at the airport has the nonexclusive right to
operate a vehicle rental concession and related services at the airport. The
concessionaire also has the privilege of leasing counter/office/storage space
at the airport, as well as ready/return vehicle areas. (b) Rules applicable to vehicle rental
concession on airport property. (1)

Solicitation. Concessionaire shall confine its solicitation of business at the
airport to signs and advertisements which have received the prior written
approval of NFTA. (2)

Open traffic
lanes. Concessionaire shall provide a sufficient number of employees in the
ready/return vehicle areas to keep traffic lanes open at all times. (3)

Illegal parking. Concessionaire shall
keep airport roadways, parking lots and areas free of rental vehicles. Any
unpaid charges for parking of rental vehicles in the airport parking lot and
any unpaid fines levied for illegal parking of rental vehicles shall be paid by
concessionaire. (4)

Traffic safety. All employees of concessionaire who operate a vehicle on airport roadways or
elsewhere on the airport shall do so in accordance with all NFTA rules and
regulations. (c) Fees and
charges. As set forth in the executed concession agreement between the NFTA and
concessionaire. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
